intro: Saxifraga bronchialis, commonly known as the lungwort saxifrage, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky, alpine environments where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. The plant features basal rosettes of fleshy, often hairy leaves that are deeply lobed or toothed. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and usually have five petals that are white or pale pink in color. Saxifraga bronchialis is known for its adaptability to harsh climates and is often used in rock gardens or alpine settings.
